**Supplementary material**

**Process engineering strategy for improved methanol production in** ***Methylosinus trichosporium*** **through enhanced mass transfer and solubility of methane and carbon dioxide**

Krishna Kalyani Sahooa, Ankan Sinhaa and Debasish Dasa, *

aDepartment of Biosciences & Bioengineering, Indian Institute of Technology, Guwahati, Assam 781039, India

*Corresponding author:

Professor,

Department of Biosciences & Bioengineering,

Indian Institute of Technology Guwahati,

Guwahati, Assam 781039, India.

Tel.: +91-361 258 2221; fax: +91-361 258 2249.

E-mail addresses: [debasishd@iitg.ac.in](mailto:debasishd@iitg.ac.in) (D. Das).

<!-- image -->

**Fig. A.1.** (a) Metabolic pathway in methanotrophs for methanol production through oxidation of methane or reduction of CO2. Methanol is produced from methane oxidation by inhibiting the activity of enzyme MDH to prevent further oxidation of methanol. MMO: methane monooxygenase, MDH: methanol dehydrogenase, FADH: formaldehyde dehydrogenase, FDH: formate dehydrogenase, NADH: nicotinamide adenine dinucleotide hydrogen, PQQ: pyrroloquinoline quinone, and RuMP: ribulose monophosphate; (b) Stoichiometric equation to produce methanol from CO2; and (c) Methanol production from CO2 under experimental conditions.

<!-- image -->

**Fig. A.2.** Dynamic profile for (a) methanol, (b) biomass, and (c) pH under varying operating pressures in high-pressure stirred tank reactor. Significant differences (p ≤ 0.05) were noted through statistical analysis using one-way ANOVA.

**Table A.1.** Comparison of methanol production by methanotrophs under different process conditions and reactor types.

| Methanotroph                                                        | Substrate                                                             | Process/Reactor specifications                                                                                                                            | Methanol/Biomass titer/yield   | References                 |
|---------------------------------------------------------------------|-----------------------------------------------------------------------|-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|--------------------------------|----------------------------|
| *Methylosinus*  *trichosporium*  IMV 3011                           | CO2: air  (50:40)                                                     | Batch culture;  100 mL conical flask                                                                                                                      | 0.004 μmol/mg dry cell weight  | Xin et al., 2007           |
| Methylosinus sporium                                                | CO2-air (30:70)                                                       | Batch culture;  120 mL serum bottle                                                                                                                       | 0.33 mM                        | Patel et al., 2016         |
| *Methylocystis bryophila*  DSM 21852                                | CO2: air (15:85)                                                      | Covalent immobilization of cells on chitosan;  Repeated-batch culture (5 cycles); 120 mL serum bottle                                                     | 0.52 mM  (0.017 g L-1)         | Patel et al., 2018         |
| Methylotuvimicrobium alcaliphilum                                   | Methane: oxygen (1:1)                                                 | Fed-batch culture, 14 L fermenter                                                                                                                         | 0.418 g L-1                    | Kulkarni et al., 2021      |
| *Methylosinus trichosporium*  OB3b                                  | Methane: air (1:1)                                                    | Batch-mode with continuous feeding of methane-air mixture; Cylindrical reactor with circulation diffusion system (Total volume: 3 L, working volume: 1 L) | 13.7 mM  (0.44 g L-1)          | Kim et al., 2010           |
| *Methylosinus trichosporium*  NCIMB 11131                           | CO2: air (1:1)                                                        | Batch culture, 250 mL Airtight batch reactor                                                                                                              | 0.58 g L-1                     | Sahoo et al., 2022         |
| *Methylocystis bryophila*  DSM 21852                                | Simulated biogas mixture of Methane: CO2 (2:1)                        | Covalent immobilization of cells on chitosan;  Repeated-batch culture (8 cycles); 120 mL serum bottle                                                     | 25.75 mM  (0.82 g L-1)         | Patel et al., 2018         |
| Methylocella tundrae                                                | Biogas derived from anaerobic digestion of potato peels (30% methane) | Covalent immobilization of cells on banana leaves; Repeated-batch culture (8 cycles); 10 mL serum bottle                                                  | 25.86 mM  (0.83 g L-1)         | Patel et al., 2021         |
| *Methylocaldum sp.*  14B                                            | Biogas: air (1:2.5)                                                   | Trickle-bed reactor packed with ceramic balls (1.24 L)                                                                                                    | 0.9 g L-1 d-1                  | Sheets et al., 2017        |
| *Methylosinus trichosporium*  OB3b                                  | Methane: oxygen (1:1)                                                 | Batch culture; Bubble-free membrane aerated  bioreactor (Total volume: 500 mL, working volume: 300 mL)                                                    | 0.95 g L-1                     | Duan et al., 2011          |
| Methanotrophic strains (AS1 and AS2) isolated from activated sludge | Methane: air (50:50)                                                  | Batch and sequencing batch mode (5 cycles);  External-loop airlift bioreactor (working volume: 1 L)                                                       | 1.6 g L-1                      | Ghaz-Jahanian et al., 2018 |
| Methylocystis bryophila                                             | Methane: air (30:70)                                                  | Covalent immobilization of cells on coconut coir; Repeated-batch culture (8 cycles); 120 mL serum bottle                                                  | 52.9 mM  (1.69 g L-1)          | Patel et al., 2020a        |
| *Methylosinus trichosporium*  NCIMB 11131                           | CO2: air  (1:1)                                                       | Batch culture;  High-pressure stirred tank reactor (Total volume: 2 L; working volume: 1.2 L); Optimum operating pressure: 4 bar                          | 61.8 mM  (1.98 g L-1)          | This study                 |
